greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of integer solutions to x^2 + 2*y^2 + 2*z^2 = n.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..5000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Theta series of quadratic form with Gram matrix [ 1, 0, 0; 0, 2, 0; 0, 0, 2 ].
Expansion of phi(q) * phi(q^2)^2 = phi(-q^4)^4 / phi(-q) in powers of q where phi() is a Ramanujan theta function.
Expansion of eta(q^2) * eta(q^4)^8 / (eta(q)^2 * eta(q^8)^4) in powers of q.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (8 t)) = 4 (t/i)^(3/2) g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. for A014455.
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ EllipticTheta[ 3, 0, q] EllipticTheta[ 3, 0, q^2]^2, {q, 0, n}];
program: (PARI) {a(n) = local(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x^2 + A) * eta(x^4 + A)^8 / (eta(x + A)^2 * eta(x^8 + A)^4), n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Aug 31 2014
